metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4035 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
scripts/xzgrep.in in xzgrep 5.2.x before 5.2.0, before 5.0.0 does not properly process file names containing semicolons, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by having a user run xzgrep on a crafted file name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblzma5 - 5.1.1alpha+20110809-3
xz-utils - 5.1.1alpha+20110809-3
xzdec - 5.1.1alpha+20110809-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xz-utils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.1alpha+20110809-3').
